00054   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00055   // How to Read/Write volume data contained by this node.
00056   // This sub-node should contain information specific to each
00057   // type of volume that needs to be read in.  This can be used
00058   // to clean up the special cases in this file which handle
00059   // volumes of various types, such as dicom, header, etc.  In
00060   // future these things can be moved to the sub-node specific for that
00061   // type of volume.  The sub-nodes here that describe specific volume
00062   // types each correspond to an implementation of the reader/writer,
00063   // which can be found in a vtkMrmlDataVolumeReadWrite subclass.
00064   //--------------------------------------------------------------------------
00065   vtkSetObjectMacro(ReadWriteNode, vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode);
00066   vtkGetObjectMacro(ReadWriteNode, vtkMrmlVolumeReadWriteNode);

00214   // Description:
00215   // MR Diffusion Tensor Images may be saved on disk with 
00216   // the frequency encode direction non-standard.  For supine
00217   // scans in the slicer, set this to 1 for in-plane 
00218   // rotation/axis swaps which will put the images into standard
00219   // ax/sag/cor orientations.  This is currently a boolean variable
00220   // here and not written to MRML; its effects are seen in the 
00221   // RasToIjk matrix.  In future this boolean, or a better description
00222   // of the transformation, may be put into the MRML format.
00223   vtkGetMacro(FrequencyPhaseSwap, int);
00224   vtkSetMacro(FrequencyPhaseSwap, int);

00276   // Description:
00277   // The matrix that transforms a point in RAS space to IJK space. 
00278   // The 4x4 matrix is listed as a string of 16 numbers in row-major order.

00280   vtkGetStringMacro(RasToIjkMatrix);

00282   // Description:
00283   // Same as the rasToIjkMatrix except the y-axis is directed up instead 
00284   // of down, as is the convention in VTK
00285   vtkSetStringMacro(RasToVtkMatrix);
00286   vtkGetStringMacro(RasToVtkMatrix);

00290   // orientation of the volume, but not the voxel size

00294 
00295   // Description:
00296   // This function solves the 4x4 matrix equation
00297   // A*B=C for the unknown matrix A, given matrices B and C.
00298   // While this is equivalent to A=C*Inverse(B), this function uses
00299   // faster and more accurate methods (LU factorization) than finding a 
00300   // matrix inverse and multiplying.  Returns 0 on failure.
00301   static int SolveABeqCforA(vtkMatrix4x4 * A,  vtkMatrix4x4 * B,
00302                 vtkMatrix4x4 * C);
00303   static int SolveABeqCforB(vtkMatrix4x4 * A,  vtkMatrix4x4 * B,
00304                 vtkMatrix4x4 * C);
00305
